intro: Triathera americana, commonly known as the American triathera, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetland areas and thrives in moist, sunny environments. The leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
